message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.CC, cs.DM 

Reasoning: 
1. cs.IT (Information Theory) - The paper deals with the generator matrices of polar codes and Reed-Muller codes, which are important topics in information theory. 
2. cs.DS (Discrete Mathematics) - The paper investigates the properties of index sets selecting rows in the generator matrices, which involves combinatorial and discrete mathematical techniques. 
3. cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) - The paper may be relevant to the study of network coding and communication in social and information networks. 
4. cs.CC (Computational Complexity) - The paper may involve computational complexity analysis of the algorithms used for selecting rows in the generator matrices. 
5. cs.DM (Data Structures and Algorithms) - The paper may involve the development of new algorithms or data structures for selecting rows in the generator matrices.
